main.name: James Opara
main.description: I want to use my programming skills to help create software that not only improves business productivity but also improves the experience of its users
main.bio: Forward-thinking, open-minded, creative and detail-oriented Full Stack software developer. Capable of thriving alone or in a team environment, and always excited to learn, grow and evolve. I've worked with HTML5, CSS3, Javascript, Node.js, Express.js, React.js, Ember.js, AJAX, MongoDB, PostgreSQL, Python, and Django. I am charismatic and very naturally proficient at building and maintaining strong professional relationships. I possess great critical thinking and problem-solving skills, and I am dedicated to completing the tasks at hand. Currently open to new opportunities and open to working remotely.

resume.skillmessage: The tech that I use to do what I do.

work.title: Software Developer
work.description: Designing and building custom software applications for businesses, government institutions, and healthcare institutions. Weekly conference calls with clients from BARDA and the Department of Health and Human Services. Made significant direct contributions to the design and maintenance of medicalcountermeasures.gov. Contributing to multiple projects from different clients at once. Building mockups using Adobe Creative Cloud. Working with Angular, Javascript, Ionic, JQuery, HTML, CSS, Sass, and Bootstrap 4 to build responsive front-end UIs. Using remote desktop software to work with both Windows and macOS. Working with Node.js, C#, and ASP.NET MVC on the back-end. 100% remote and communicating with team members via Skype.

work.title: Freelance Software Developer
work.description: Building websites and web apps for businesses and individual clients for a reasonable price within a reasonable timeframe.

work.title: Software Engineer Fellow
work.description: Three-month, 420-hour full-time and Full-Stack program conducted in a remote setting. Built several proof-of-concept applications and deployed projects within three months. Worked with and built RESTful APIs. Created responsive Front-End UIs. Worked with modern Front-End and Back-End programming languages, tools, and methodologies including HTML 5, CSS 3, Bootstrap 4, ES6 Javascript, AJAX, React.js, Python 3, Django, PostgreSQL, MongoDB, Node.js, Express.js, Git/Github, and Agile/Scrum.

skills.name: HTML
skills.description: My first step to learning web development was learning HTML

skills.name: CSS
skills.description: I use CSS to add colors and designs to my projects. I use Flexbox a lot too.

skills.name: Javascript
skills.description: Personally, Javascript is my favorite programming language. It is the first language I learned how to use, and the language that I am most familiar with.

skills.name: React.js
skills.description: React's component-based methodology was a bit confusing to me at first, but I am making it a point to continue to use it and I am improving my skills with React as I go.

skills.name: Node.js
skills.description: Node was the first backend language that I learned to use, and it is the backend language I am most comfortable with. I learned to use Express.js shortly after starting with Node.

skills.name: Python
skills.description: Python is an interesting, fun, and super powerful programming language. I started using it after Javascript, and I want to master it.

skills.name: Django
skills.description: Django is a great back-end language that allows me to create RESTful API's and give applications full CRUD capability with minimal code.

skills.name: C#
skills.description: C# is a new language for me. I know it is a powerful language, and I am hoping to use it to broaden my skills as a developer and improve my marketability as both a freelancer and a professional developer.

skills.name: ASP.Net
skills.description: Along with C#, ASP.NET is new for me. I intend to learn it to become a better and more marketable developer.

skills.name: MongoDB
skills.description: One of the two database technologies that I use to store data. I use MongoDB when I'm building backends with Node.js/Express.js.

skills.name: PostgreSQL
skills.description: The relational database technology I use when I'm building backends with Python/Django.

skills.name: GitHub
skills.description: My General Assembly instructors taught me how to use GitHub to store my code and projects and I've been using it ever since.

projects.title: Pharmacy Flash Cards
projects.category: My first class project from General Assembly. I was a pharmacy technician for 7 years, so I created this learning game.

projects.title: Hack Overflow
projects.category: My second project from General Assembly. I built it to pay homage to Stack Overflow since I was using it multiple times a day.

projects.title: Medical Countermeasures
projects.category: MCM enhances the United States' public health emergency preparedness.
